title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: outlines propose change glyvis. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("glycoverse/glyvis", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to glyvis
text: Please note glyvis project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Get Started with glyvis
text: Think glyvis versatile artist two distinct painting styles: autoplot() — intelligent assistant automatically crafts suitable plots glystats results plot_xxx() — precision toolkit creating specific visualizations exactly envision Let’s see action. create PCA plot, can take direct route plot_pca() exp data:  Alternatively, can take analytical pathway: first conducting PCA analysis glystats::gly_pca(), letting autoplot() work magic statistical results.  first approach gets quickly, second pathway unlocks world possibilities results. gain access underlying statistical objects advanced analyses, can craft custom ggplot2 masterpieces tailored publications. beauty autoplot() lies versatility—speaks fluent glystats across nearly every analysis type. Explore complete reference discover full spectrum autoplot() capabilities specialized plot_xxx() functions.
code: plot_pca(exp) pca_res <- gly_pca(exp) autoplot(pca_res)

title: Get Started with glyvis
text: Let’s set expectations straight: glyvis isn’t publication graphics department. Creating truly stunning, publication-ready figures art form demands thoughtful customization. Every compelling visualization emerges careful consideration countless decisions: Focus: story data want tell? Scale: much visual real estate make message shine without overwhelming? Layout: can multiple plots dance together harmoniously? Palette: colors captivate staying true data? Annotation: labels text guide reader’s eye? Polish: devil’s details—legends, fonts, ticks, axes, grids… creative choices flow intimate knowledge data scientific context. glyvis doesn’t presume make artistic decisions . Instead, think glyvis data exploration companion. excels born : transforming glystats results instant, informative visuals. ’s first glimpse data’s soul, helping spot patterns generate hypotheses speed thought.

title: Authors and Citation
text: First Last. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Last F (2025). glyvis: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.3.1.9000, https://glycoverse.github.io/glyvis/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {glyvis: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {First Last},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.3.1.9000},   url = {https://glycoverse.github.io/glyvis/}, }

what: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: goal glyvis visualize everything glycoverse ecosystem. Visualization essential part data analysis. Human beings sensitive visual information text numbers. Plotting helps us understand data better. glyvis provides unified interface visualizing glycoverse data, including statistical results, experiments, glycan biosynthesis pathways, . implements autoplot() method various glycoverse data structures. Just autoplot() !

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: can install latest release glyvis GitHub : install development version:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("glycoverse/glyvis@*release") remotes::install_github("glycoverse/glyvis")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: 📚 Reference:

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: main purpose glyvis provide visualization glystats results. implements autoplot() methods result class glystats, users can visualize results directly get quick overview. also provides visualization functions glycoverse data structures, glyexp::experiment(), glyrepr::glycan_structure(), others. package intended produce publication-quality figures, provide quick exploration data.

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
code: library(glyexp) library(glyclean) #>  #> Attaching package: 'glyclean' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     aggregate library(glystats) library(glyvis)  exp <- auto_clean(real_experiment) #> ℹ Normalizing data (Median) #> ✔ Normalizing data (Median) [79ms] #>  #> ℹ Removing variables with >50% missing values #> ✔ Removing variables with >50% missing values [10ms] #>  #> ℹ Imputing missing values #> ℹ Sample size <= 30, using sample minimum imputation #> ℹ Imputing missing values✔ Imputing missing values [11ms] #>  #> ℹ Aggregating data #> ✔ Aggregating data [376ms] #>  #> ℹ Normalizing data again #> ✔ Normalizing data again [8ms]  pca_res <- gly_pca(exp) autoplot(pca_res)

title: Plots for Experiments — autoplot.glyexp_experiment
text: Visualization glyexp::experiment() (glyexp_experiment object). Possible types plots: "heatmap": (Default) Expression heatmap columns samples rows variables. "boxplot": Boxplot expression values sample.

code: # S3 method for class 'glyexp_experiment' autoplot(object, type = "heatmap", group_col = "group", ...)

title: Plots for Experiments — autoplot.glyexp_experiment
text: object glyexp_experiment object. type type plot, one "heatmap" (default) "boxplot". group_col character string specifying find group information. column sample information tibble. Defaults "group". applicable "boxplot". ... Ignored.

title: Plots for Experiments — autoplot.glyexp_experiment
text: ggplot object.

Defaults "o1". groups factor character vector specifying group membership sample. provided, plot colored group. applicable "scores" "loadings" types. group_col character string specifying find group information. uses glystats::gly_oplsda() glyexp::experiment() get result, sample information already added result. case, can specify column name sample information tibble used coloring. provided, function try "group". ... title: Volcano Plot — plot_volcano
text: function accepts glyexp::experiment(), performs differential expression analysis using glystats::gly_limma(), plots volcano plot. two groups.

title: Volcano Plot — plot_volcano
code: plot_volcano(   exp,   group_col = "group",   test = "limma",   p_adj_method = "BH",   ref_group = NULL,   ... )

title: Volcano Plot — plot_volcano
text: exp glyexp::experiment() object. group_col character string specifying column name sample information contains group labels. Default "group". test "ttest", "wilcox", "limma". Default "limma". p_adj_method character string specifying method adjust p-values. See p.adjust.methods available methods. Default "BH". NULL, adjustment performed. ref_group character string specifying reference group. NULL (default), first level group factor used reference. ... arguments passed EnhancedVolcano::EnhancedVolcano().

title: Volcano Plot — plot_volcano
text: ggplot object.

what: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
title: Objects exported from other packages — reexports
text: objects imported packages. Follow links see documentation. ggplot2 autoplot

title: glyvis 0.3.1
text: Fix bugs introduced breaking changes glyexp 0.10.0.

title: glyvis 0.3.0
text: Add test parameter plot_volcano() specify statistical test type. Add plot_boxplot() plot grouped boxplots experiment objects. ROC curves can plotted glystats::gly_roc() results using autoplot() now. Add plot_roc() plot ROC curves directly experiment objects.

title: glyvis 0.3.0
text: Better volcano plots using EnhancedVolcano package. Fix inconsistent behaviour plotting experiment objects autoplot(). Previously, boxplots actually plotted type = "barplot". Now boxplots grouped group column plotted, faceted variables, type = "boxplot". Use rlang::check_installed() better optional dependency checking.

title: glyvis 0.2.1
text: Adapt breaking changes glystats v0.5.0.

title: glyvis 0.2.0
text: Add plot_logo() plot logo plots glycosites.

title: glyvis 0.2.0
text: Re-export autoplot() ggplot2 prevent ‘find function “autoplot”’ error ggplot2 loaded. Add Get Started vignette.

title: glyvis 0.1.2
text: Update dependencies depend release versions glycoverse packages.

title: glyvis 0.1.1
text: Fix bugs tests introduced glyexp v0.8.0.

title: glyvis 0.1.0
text: First release.
